title: PIA (Private Internet Access) Split Tunnel feature significantly slowing down Firefox specifically
content:
So I've been using PIA for years (it's the only VPN I can find that has simple port forwarding and split tunnel/reverse split tunnel) and once they switched over to their app's 3.0 version, (like 3 or so years ago, I switched to Mullvad previously until they removed port forwarding recently) I noticed some extreme slowdowns. Specifically, just searching things takes 5-10 seconds to fully load the page. Opening a YouTube video has me sitting there for 15-60 seconds just watching the loading thing just spin and spin (once the video starts, I can load 4K60fps+ video perfectly fine), I can't even consistently access my bank account website because it's so incredibly slow. Most general websites take 10+ seconds to just load when they normally wouldn't. My internet is 400 down/10 up, in case you were wondering.

I've contacted PIA's support over the course of many many months, multiple times, and they are about as helpful as a cockroach you find upside down in the middle of your floor. I've tried messing with every setting on the app and have narrowed it down to the split tunnel feature of the app. Telling this to PIA support does nothing, they just go "glad you found what the issue is" without helping me fix it. I don't want my entire computer under the VPN, which is why split tunnel (and reverse split tunnel) is important to me. I specifically have Firefox (and Firefox Dev) as set to bypass the VPN, and that's how I get the aforementioned issues.

The reason I feel like this is a Firefox-specific issue is that this only happens with Firefox. (and Firefox Dev) I've tried Chrome, Edge, even (shudder) Opera GX, put them as bypass on the PIA app, and have no issues loading anything. Searches are instant, YT videos don't even load, they just start playing immediately, there are no issues.

Note that when I set Firefox to use the VPN instead of bypass it, it loads perfectly fine, just a bit slower than normal since the VPN server is in a different country, but it's still much faster than if it was bypassing it. I'm not sure what else to try at this point, I've been slowly using Chrome more and more solely so I don't have to wait so long for every web page to load, and I hate that. I would love for any ideas to be bounced around on what to do, cause I can't find anyone else with this specific issue, nor PIA support being any help. Any ideas would be greatly, greatly appreciated, I've been dealing with this issue for years now.
creator: Dorraj

title: Špatně se zobrazují stránky
content:
Dobrý den,

již nějakou dobu pozoruji problém s FireFoxem, že se mi špatně zobrazují některé webové stránky nebo se nezobrazí vůbec. Podotýkám, že při použití konkurenčního prohlížeče žádný problém se zobrazením nenastal a FF mám aktualizovaný. Průběžně aktualizuji i ovladače grafické karty přes GeForce Experience.

Používám email od seznam.cz, zde se špatně zobrazuje, resp. překrývá zobrazení přepínání mezi účty (viz. screenshot). Rovněž na webu novinky.cz, který patří pod společnost Seznam, pokud mi přijde upozornění, že někdo reagoval v diskuzi na můj příspěvek, tato reakce se po rozkliknutí nezobrazí. Musím zkopírovat adresu odkazu a vložit do jiného prohlížeče, aby se mi reakce zobrazila správně. Tyto problémy jsou trvalé.

Další problém je, že občas po kliknutí na nějaký odkaz se stránka zobrazí správně a po cca 1 sekundě se objeví bílá, "rozmazaná" stránka s chybovou hláškou, kterou nelze přečíst. Tento problém je občasný, proto ho nedokážu nasimulovat.

Podobný občasný problém je se serverem YouTube.com, kdy se server po kliknutí na odkaz z vyhledávače google.cz neúměrně dlouho načítá a nakonec se nenačte. Po opětovném kliknutí na odkaz se načte.

Nevím, co je původem těchto problémů.

Prosím o odpověď na email nakorr@seznam.cz.

Děkuji.

Patrik Makovec
creator: nakorr

title: How do I get my bookmarks menu star to display on my home page?

On my own computer, a Dell laptop running Windows 10, my Firefox 118 is customized to my satisfaction. In particular, in the upper right, from right to left, there are five icons: three lines for accessing a Firefox functions menu, a "puzzle piece" icon for accessing add-ons, a U-Block Origin icon for that ad blocker, a set of vertical lines that let me access some bookmarks and history settings, and a star that, when clicked, displays my whole bookmarks menu tree, showing a combination of individual URLs and URL folders that I saved there. 

    Now I am trying to set up a new Dell laptop the same way. It's running Windows 11, and I cannot find a way to display that Firefox menu star. It's got the other star (the "save to favorites" star, farther to the left), but I cannot find a way to display that "show me my bookmarks" star. How do I get that icon to display?

title: ChromeOS Firefox Desktop Support Enable Wayland by default
content:
Currently running ChromeOS and I have successfully run the Desktop install via crostini / debian which is now using Firefox-esr 115. By default via about:support we can see the it is running xwayland. I decided to search and find a way to run strictly wayland, with the following terminal command 'MOZ_ENABLE_WAYLAND=1 firefox' which succeeds in running it with wayland.

Note: Added benefit is touch responsiveness works by default, a key feature for most ChromeOS devices. It also makes it much easier to stop using Chrome Browser on ChromeOS devices.

Please enable this feature by default, thanks!

title: Input tags are broken on first load of page
content:
I am a developer of AIO Tests, its a test management app that runs inside Jira.

We have been encountering a problem with input tags in our app when running on Firefox for some time now, has even been reported by a few customers now.

When we click on a link for our app, and it opens in a new tab, the users are unable to click or type inside the input area unless they do any of the following:

  • Bulleted list item Go to a different tab and come back
  • Bulleted list item Open the developer options and then click on the input bar again
  • Bulleted list item Lose focus of firefox app itself, and come back.

At which point the problem fixes itself.

We have been able to consistently reproduce this problem, this is a firefox only issue, we tested in Chrome and Safari, but unable to recreate it over there.

Is this a known issue? Is there any known fix for this that we can implement from our end?

issue submitted to bugzilla: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1857865
creator: sidagarwal14799

title: Why does Copy Image make HEAD request to server and how to prevent it?
content:
Hi!

When I open Tools > Browser Tools > Browser Toolbox (Ctrl + Alt + Shift + I) and then go to Network tab then I see browser requests. When I right click image and then choose Copy Image it makes HEAD request to server. And then based on that result seems decide how to copy this image. For example if server responds with 403 to this head request I can still paste copied image to MS paint for example. But I can not paste such images to websites. Such as Yandex reverse image search for example.

Why does firefox behave like that and how to disable it?

To investigate the issue her is a sample clipboard event handler that can take image from clipboard: https://pastebin.com/KNKfPGcy

If HEAD request gets 403 response then this clipboard code will cause the following to be posted instead of image: <Error>AccessDenied<Message>Access Denied</Message><RequestId>6HRMZAKJPFCNZ6QS</RequestId><HostId>ANuZElpxuSerm5iGttCRay/SCAaDuc3Qv1WPxJGHQRJqsGISjyxxG68EFtw9xHDdgnmqtuAZqsg=</HostId></Error>

This situation can happen for example when I open image on new tab and then the server removes image or link gets expired and then I want to copy this image. It causes annoyance where when I want to paste it to some other web site I first have to paste it in MS Paint and then select all and copy in MS paint to finally get image that I can freely paste everywhere.

Seems like this is some deliberately made user hostile behavior in Firefox. How can I disable it? And besides, isn't it a privacy concern when every time I click Copy Image server is notified? I mean someone else should not know that I am about to copy their image.
creator: wybqogzigoxruxdhnp

title: Hide Bookmarks bar shortcuts text.
content:
there used to be an add on called roomy bookmarks that stopped working so people found ways around to replicate it and it works on win 10 but I just switched to Win 11 and this solution doesnt seem to work anymore for me, anyone know if i need to change anything? 

    Locate your firefox profile folder, in this article they say where you can find it: http://kb.mozillazine.org/Profile_folder    Find your profile folder mine was: C:\Users\***\AppData\Roaming\Mozilla\Firefox\Profiles\***.default\    Locate a folder called chrome (if it doesn't exists create one through your O.S) must be lowercase    Locate inside chrome folder the file: userChrome.css (if it doesn't exists create one through your O.S, google how to create a .css file on notepad) Chrome must be cased as shown above    Add the code: https://pastebin.com/1r6cc8hW    Restart Firefox, now you are done, if you don't want text to be displayed within the icons just remove the last line.

This is the line of code i have in css file that works for me in my win 10 machine.

/* 

* Recreates the basic functionality of the popular Roomy Bookmarks Toolbar add-on in Firefox 57+. * Uncomment the section with the functionality that you want, leave all other sections commented. * This only affects toplevel toolbar bookmarks and folders, bookmarks and subfolders in folders are unaffected. * The tooltips on long hover (showing bookmark name and link) are unaffected. */ 
/* some margin settings, do not comment out */

.bookmark-item > .toolbarbutton-text { 

 margin-top: -1px !important;

} .bookmark-item { 

 margin: -1px !important;

}


/* No text on toolbar bookmarks; Text on bookmark folders. No hover effect. */

  1. PlacesToolbarItems > .bookmark-item:not([container]):not([open="true"]) > .toolbarbutton-text { 
 display: none !important;

}

  1. PlacesToolbarItems > .bookmark-item:not([container]):not([open="true"]) > .toolbarbutton-icon[label]:not([label=""]) { 
 margin-inline-end: 0px !important;

}


/* No text on toolbar bookmarks; No text on bookmark folders. Show bookmark text on hover. */ /*

  1. PlacesToolbarItems > .bookmark-item:not(:hover):not([open="true"]) > .toolbarbutton-text { 
 display: none !important;

}

  1. PlacesToolbarItems > .bookmark-item:not(:hover):not([open="true"]) > .toolbarbutton-icon[label]:not([label=""]) { 
 margin-inline-end: 0px !important;

}

  • /


/* No text on toolbar bookmarks; Text on bookmark folders. Show bookmark text on hover. */ /*

  1. PlacesToolbarItems > .bookmark-item:not(:hover):not([container]):not([open="true"]) > .toolbarbutton-text { 
 display: none !important;

}

  1. PlacesToolbarItems > .bookmark-item:not(:hover):not([container]):not([open="true"]) > .toolbarbutton-icon[label]:not([label=""]) { 
 margin-inline-end: 0px !important;

}

  • /

does anyone have a workaround or a similar add on? i would like to have my booksmarks as shown in the screenshot on my win 11 pc as well.
creator: meromex_102
